formattedAddress: 1528 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10031, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1528 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10031, USA

editorialSummary.text: Southern plates plus breakfast & brunch served in a chill cafe with exposed-brick walls & live jazz.

originalText.text: Entering this restaurant you could immediately tell you were going to get a nice home atmosphere. It was empty for a Sunday but that was probably because college was out, this place is very close to city college. Me and my friend sat down and admired the exposed brick and plants the had in the space. We then ordered our food. I ended up getting the chicken and waffle plate. When my food came out I was happy about the portion I had received! The waffle was delicious, the chicken left more to be desired. The plate also came with 2 eggs and your choice of meat, I got the turkey sausage. To tell you the truth the meal could have done without the chicken and would have been perfect. The price for the two meals was good and wouldn't break anyone's wallet. I definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to eat in a homie atmosphere.

originalText.text: Cutest little place to get a quick delicious meal…tastes like mamas home cooking!!

text.text: Cutest little place to get a quick delicious meal…tastes like mamas home cooking!!

originalText.text: I can here for Mother’s Day earlier this year and thought the food was great then - this time around it was excellent! You MUST try the turkey sausage, egg, and cheese biscuit. And get the grits - the grits are awesome. Plus, staff were really sweet and welcoming.

text.text: I can here for Mother’s Day earlier this year and thought the food was great then - this time around it was excellent! You MUST try the turkey sausage, egg, and cheese biscuit. And get the grits - the grits are awesome. Plus, staff were really sweet and welcoming.

originalText.text:
I recently had the pleasure of working with Home Sweet Harlem catering for a repast, and I am thrilled to share my wonderful experience. Not only did they provide delicious soul food, but they also delivered everything on time and in a professional manner. And the best part? They were surprisingly budget-friendly.

Right from the beginning, the  owner, Donna, showed care and dedication during a sensitive time as well as  delivering excellent service. During the initial consultation, she listened attentively to our needs and worked with us to create a customized menu that fit within our budget. She made the entire planning process stress-free and enjoyable.

On the day of the repast, the staff arrived promptly and set up the serving station.

Now, let's talk about the food - it was absolutely outstanding. The soul food dishes were fresh, hot and cooked to perfection, with flavors that everyone raved about. From the classic southern fried chicken to the delectable mac and cheese, every dish was a delightful treat. But the stand out were the savory collard greens! Several of the guests called me afterwards to find out who cooked them!

Overall, I cannot recommend Home Sweet Harlem enough to cater your next event. Their delicious soul food, professional service, and budget-friendly approach make them a standout choice. Home Sweet Harlem is a gem that you don't want to miss.

originalText.text: I was happy and surprised to find the restaurant practically empty save for 2 tables (one finished and one still eating).  My disappointment started immediately when 2 or 3 staff people passed by (one young man came by twice with his hands up as though he was scrubbed in to perform surgery) a time or 2 without acknowledging us in any way.  After about 5 minutes a young lady asked for our vaccine verification and instructed us to seat ourselves.  The young lady took our drink order and quickly brought the water and told us to use the QR code for the menu. About 5 minutes after getting the water, 2 gentlemen sat themselves (prior to showing proof of vaccination) and left about 10 minutes later when no one had come to their table.  A few minutes later we heard someone say, "they left?". we let another 5 - 10 minutes pass before reminding the staff that we were still waiting to place an order.  A nice young lady finally took our order and 20 minutes later we still had no food nor had anyone checked on us which would be easy as we were still the only people in the restaurant.  I did notice LOTS of delivery drivers come and go as we waited for our food.  About 5 minutes after asking for our food a young man came to say, "we just waiting for the biscuits to come out of the oven".  Remember, THERE ARE NO OTHER CUSTOMERS IN THE RESTAURANT.  There's more but I'm tired.  The food was good except for the scrambled eggs I ordered without cheese that came with cheese and inedible (see photo). I tried to tell the young man that if we were told upfront that even though the place was empty, we would not get food for an hour we could have made an informed decision to come another time or be prepared for the wait.  I also mentioned that they should have comped us the salmon cake appetizer ($6) we ordered as a gesture of good will.  Unfortunately, as it stands now this is a place I don't want to return to or recommend.
